intro: Ottonia consanguinea, commonly known as the red-flowered ottonia, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branched stems and aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, depending on the variety. Ottonia consanguinea is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, shady environments. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and ecological restoration projects.
